instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Keyboard Only Working If I Hold Keys for 2 Seconds
threads.message:
Hello,

I received a MacBook with keyboard and trackpad issue. There was water damage on the trackpad connector and keyboard itself which I replaced both already. I also found that the <RESISTOR>R4830</RESISTOR> pull-up resistor for the 3.3v to pin 10 was fried and giving 0 volts. Replaced the resistor and the keyboard / trackpad started working. However, after a few minutes of it working, the keys would stop. Only if I hold the keys for 1-2 seconds would the keys register and I would have to restart the computer in order for it to work normally for 1-2 minutes and then it would stop working again. Has anyone experienced something similar before?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Keyboard Only Working If I Hold Keys for 2 Seconds
threads.message:
Trackpad works correctly all the time?

Check <RESISTOR>R4850</RESISTOR>-53 and L4820.
Resolder <CHIP>U4810</CHIP>.
